item.title: Refactoring
item.description: On Friday (2024-04-26) I’m presenting on Refactoring. It is a 1hr timeslot. What do I want people to walk away feeling? That decisions about the structure of code are not permanent, that it’s healthy to experiment, we shouldn’t go into too much detail with structure unless our objects reflect the domain language lines up (see DDD). 50 min, 5 min slides, 10 slides. Fallacies— “Refactoring = Improving code” improving is about understandability, your peers it’s about structural change, not code Evolution is multiple competing ideas or things where the best wins.
